reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game will make you proud to be an American. If not, then you're probably just not an American but you're wishing you were.

Broforce is all about blowing ♥♥♥♥ up. That's basically the game. You play as various action movie heroes as you liberate Vietnam from Satan himself. The defining point of the game is it's randomness, most notably in how character selection works. When you start a level, you spawn as a random Bro and only get 1 life. As you move through the level, you find cages with other Bros trapped inside. When you break a cage and rescue a Bro, your character immediately swaps out with another random Bro, and gain an extra life. As you keep rescuing Bros, you eventually unlock more Bros to play as. The system works great, as it forces you to learn every character and makes sure that you can't play favorites. This really helps in a game like this where there's a lot of recognizable faces. Hell, if there was a character select I would probably just go Ash or John Matrix (Commandbro) all the time, the former of which I'm not very good with.

The characters aren't the only random element of the game, though. Enemies and various items spawn differently every time you restart a level. So if you lose all your lives and restart the level (I should probably get into that for a second, you don't get a Game Over when you lose all your lives. You just restart the level), that one regular grunt may now be a kamikaze, and that propane tank may be a red explosive barrel. This means that you can't use the same strategy every time you play the level. You have to adapt, and adapt quickly because there's ♥♥♥♥ blowing up everywhere and you need to ♥♥♥♥ing run.

The levels aren't randomly generated, but the game makes up for that by making them fully destructable. This opens up so many new ways to play. Do you want to run straight through, killing everyone you see, or break through the ground and sneak away? Do you want to scale the walls to get away from a pack, or quickly peek your head around them and see them all freak out and end up killing themselves somehow because the AI is designed to be incompetent? Is there a big-♥♥♥ robot that you don't wanna tango with right now? Break the ground below him and let him fall to his death! The possibilites are endless! One of the most impressive parts of the levels is that no matter how much you blow up, you can't seem to break the game. It seems like there's no way to trap yourself. I don't know how, but you can always seem to get through the level.

The enemies in this game are hilarious. Like I said, the AI is built to be incompetent. If a pack sees you, they'll go ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. It's ♥♥♥♥ing great to die by a pack of enemies, then come back to see that some idiot shot a propane tank and managed to kill the entire group, destroy the enemy clown car, and you had nothing to do with it. Not to mention that their voice lines always manage to get a rise out of me. In fact, all the voice lines in Broforce are great, especially the announcer's.

There's also something to be said about the soundtrack. There's only about four songs in the game, but there's all great, especially the boss music.

One more thing about the gameplay, do not be fooled. It may seem like you're an invincible death machine at first, but the game gets maddeningly difficult later on, as in, Threat Level: Black" difficult. As hard as that was though
date: they're not even finished developing the campaign. Be afraid. Be very very afraid.\n\nI haven't played the multiplayer yet because NONE OF MY FRIENDS OWN IT
recommended: but it's probably pretty good.\n\nIn conclusion
hoursPlayed: even in beta Broforce is a great game
voteText: and it's really shaping up to be something incredible. I highly recommend it.\n\nSCREAMING EAGLES/10"

At first I thought this was one of those games where you die alot to stupid stuff and it should be half the fun. Then I realised, this IS one of those games where you die alot to stupid stuff and it IS half the fun. So if you love dying to stupid stuff while also having an awesome epic time blowing up stuff, you'll love this game. Already in the early stage it is in, it's still great!

So, short story. Do stupid stuff, blow up things, blow up some more things and have an epicly awesome bromoment!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game will make you proud to be an American. If not, then you're probably just not an American but you're wishing you were.

Broforce is all about blowing ♥♥♥♥ up. That's basically the game. You play as various action movie heroes as you liberate Vietnam from Satan himself. The defining point of the game is it's randomness, most notably in how character selection works. When you start a level, you spawn as a random Bro and only get 1 life. As you move through the level, you find cages with other Bros trapped inside. When you break a cage and rescue a Bro, your character immediately swaps out with another random Bro, and gain an extra life. As you keep rescuing Bros, you eventually unlock more Bros to play as. The system works great, as it forces you to learn every character and makes sure that you can't play favorites. This really helps in a game like this where there's a lot of recognizable faces. Hell, if there was a character select I would probably just go Ash or John Matrix (Commandbro) all the time, the former of which I'm not very good with.

The characters aren't the only random element of the game, though. Enemies and various items spawn differently every time you restart a level. So if you lose all your lives and restart the level (I should probably get into that for a second, you don't get a Game Over when you lose all your lives. You just restart the level), that one regular grunt may now be a kamikaze, and that propane tank may be a red explosive barrel. This means that you can't use the same strategy every time you play the level. You have to adapt, and adapt quickly because there's ♥♥♥♥ blowing up everywhere and you need to ♥♥♥♥ing run.

The levels aren't randomly generated, but the game makes up for that by making them fully destructable. This opens up so many new ways to play. Do you want to run straight through, killing everyone you see, or break through the ground and sneak away? Do you want to scale the walls to get away from a pack, or quickly peek your head around them and see them all freak out and end up killing themselves somehow because the AI is designed to be incompetent? Is there a big-♥♥♥ robot that you don't wanna tango with right now? Break the ground below him and let him fall to his death! The possibilites are endless! One of the most impressive parts of the levels is that no matter how much you blow up, you can't seem to break the game. It seems like there's no way to trap yourself. I don't know how, but you can always seem to get through the level.

The enemies in this game are hilarious. Like I said, the AI is built to be incompetent. If a pack sees you, they'll go ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. It's ♥♥♥♥ing great to die by a pack of enemies, then come back to see that some idiot shot a propane tank and managed to kill the entire group, destroy the enemy clown car, and you had nothing to do with it. Not to mention that their voice lines always manage to get a rise out of me. In fact, all the voice lines in Broforce are great, especially the announcer's.

There's also something to be said about the soundtrack. There's only about four songs in the game, but there's all great, especially the boss music.

One more thing about the gameplay, do not be fooled. It may seem like you're an invincible death machine at first, but the game gets maddeningly difficult later on, as in, Threat Level: Black" difficult. As hard as that was though
date: they're not even finished developing the campaign. Be afraid. Be very very afraid.\n\nI haven't played the multiplayer yet because NONE OF MY FRIENDS OWN IT
recommended: but it's probably pretty good.\n\nIn conclusion
hoursPlayed: even in beta Broforce is a great game
voteText: and it's really shaping up to be something incredible. I highly recommend it.\n\nSCREAMING EAGLES/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Broforce is a game where you have to learn to improvise. Sure, you start out with the one Bro who has guns, but soon, you're unlocking melee-only bros, bros that only have flamethrowers and bombs, bros with certain perks that dramatically affect the way you play the game. You don't get to choose your Bro, the Bro chooses you, and like any good action hero, you gotta kill liberate them all with the cards you've been dealt. That's Bro life.

I would like Broforce more if the difficulty curve didn't spike like a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, however. Most levels are pretty much you getting the hang of Bros and creating cool explosions that fill the screen and liberate everyone in view! However this kind of thing doesn't really mesh all that well with the bosses, which are more of your Contra-sidescroller fare. One moment, you're improvising with explosives and bullets on very squishy goons, the next you've gotta figure out how the hell you're going to destroy liberate this giant tank with eight sections or push force-feed hot dogs to a Bro in a mech suit off the cliff. It's two different kinds of gameplay styles that don't mesh all that well together.

But god dammit, when it works, it works. It's one of the smartest dumb action games I've played in a while, and I can't wait to see what the final version is going to look like.

Early Access Review

Will Smith's best performance to date.  The casting director of this movie knew what they were doing.

In all seriousness: I had way more fun with this than I anticipated.  The gameplay is top notch, starting off relatively easy and simple, and working its way up to levels that you will die repeatedly, happy to do so, only to come back knowing that you can do it better this time.

Add to that Steam Workshop support and a level creator, and this game is already chock-full of content.  The devs also release frequent and meaningful updates and maintain a presence on the forums.

tl;dr  9/10 with rice

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Love 'splosions, slaughtering loads and loads of bad guys, only differentiated in their class, showers of blood and 80's/90's action movie heros? You have come to the right place, brother or sister, Broforce deliveres this all in truck or helicopter loads, fueling your power fantasies, one shell at a time.

But to be more serious, Broforce is a really fun game, lots of eye candy all over the place.
Thanks to next-gen particle effects and the pure amount of explosions being able to be rendered all over your screen, it can get rather confusing at times but i'm not saying thats even a bad thing.
In short: very nice to look at.

The movement system allows for a bunch of ways to swing you butt over all that non-american soil and if all your gracious parkour moves fail, you can still blast your way through that pesky terrorist wall, keeping you from turning the bad guys on the other side to a red pulp on the temporary floor.

Thanks to hords of enemys and lots of bros to play as, variaty is guaranteed for at least the first hours of playing, up until you've unlocked and figured out the best way to play as every bro and can speedrun your way through all story missions.

But thats the part where the level editor comes in.
Are you creative? Like to build 2D levels? Like to add tiny details that oh so often slip by most players in their unsadisfiable thirst for blood? Good, because Broforce got you covered, althought in it's current state the level editor isn't all that userfriendly, so i hope you like exploration too.

But lets say you don't feel very creative or are just plain lazy.
Not a problem, you can play levels, other Bros put together and uploaded for public enjoyment and there are levels being added every couple of days, just don't expect there to already be a new level uploaded as soon as you reload the level browser (yet).

What gets on my nerves, and thats not even the developers fault, is that there are so many co-op exclusive modes that i can't play because non of my friends can handle the freedom being dealt out in here.
This means, people like me will feel like missing out on maybe 25-30% of extra game content.
But hey, there is a way around that if you aren't entirly like me and don't mind playing with strangers around the globe, because there is actually the option to play online!

The worst thing i could honestly say about this game is that, even thought it has a level editor and an active community building new levels and, the possibility to play online with friends or strangers, it can get stale after some time of playing, so taking a break for a few days or even weeks after you got bored is advisable, wouldn't want you dragging your gun along the ground, out of pure unmotivation, while boredly stabbing Terrorist #1369 again.

So all in all, if you've got some money to blow on games, why not give this very entertaining and gory, if a bit mindless at times, Freedom Simulator a chance?

reviewText:
Broforce is a classic retro side-scrolling action game featuring your favorite iconic characters from Hollywood  films.

The game offers you brilliant platforming and fast paced shoot-em-up action, pitting you into environments which have destructable terrain making it more difficult for the player, forcing you to think about your every action strategically later on in the game, especially the harder levels.

The 8-bit graphics match the consistency of the sound and music. Although the voice overs are much to over-used and you may get tired of hearing 3... 2... 1... GO!!" by the end of the game. In short
date: the graphics and sound are not anything spectacular
recommended: even for your average 8-bit indie game. What makes this game special is the gameplay and the wide array of characters which each have their own unique style and abilities.\n\nLove and hate. What some users don't particularly like about this game is that you can't ever choose the character you want to play as
hoursPlayed: the developers say they made the game randomly select characters for you to keep you on your toes. There are some times I wish I could be Predator or Blade (Wesley Snipes) for a whole level but sadly cannot. Thankfully
voteText: the vast array of characters makes up for this and the unlocking system makes you excited for who will be unlocked next.\n\nLife is hard. Even though your hero may br a bad-azz from a movie such as Terminator or The Matrix
helpfulPercent: you still die in one hit
votesHelpful: one bullet is all it takes and you can also die from things falling on top of you
votesTotal: or even debris from explosions. There are also plenty of mini-bosses and bosses in the game to keep the player on their toes.\n\nYou can play up to 4-player local co-op or online. I
commentsCount: played through the game alone and still had a blast. Try this if you are a movie buff or enjoy 2D games with destruction.\n\nThis review was based on the current build as of writing. Game was bought on Steam's holiday sale."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

FREEDOM!

Take control of your tiny pixelated action hero BRO and LIBERATE the world from TERRORISM and maybe CORRUPT EVIL CORPORATE PEOPLE depending on who that red dude with the horns and the business suit is (could it be... SATAN?!). LIBERATE the forests. LIBERATE the jungles. LIBERATE the villages. LIBERATE the cities. LIBERATE the xenomorph hives.

Oh, you basically annihilated the level because your massively overpowered BRO GUNS blew up all the terrain? GREAT. You had to destroy the village in order to save it? AWESOME. Let EXPLOSIONS ring like FREEDOM all across the land.

Buy this game because it is fun on steroids and to strike a blow for LIBERTY and AMERICA THE FREE WORLD AMERICA. If you don't, you're clearly a Commie TERRORIST.

***

In all seriousness, it's a platforming shoot-em-up with destructable everything and chained explosions that can really scratch that arcade itch. It doesn't take itself seriously at all and with levels taking about five minutes if you happen to take your time and try to play smart (rather than just blowing everything up, which can be fun), there's no problem with it being arcade-hard at times since you never lose that much progress. The one absurdly tough boss they had--the infamous massive helicopter--they nerfed, which is kinda sad, because when you beat that thing you felt a real feeling of achievement. The pacing is actually pitch-perfect because while frenetic explosions-a-go-go happen a lot you can often times hang back and decide whether or not you really do want to rush in where angels fear to tread (of course you do).

This game's only gone from strength to strength in its development. It built some solid platforming fundamentals first--even the Brototype was absurdly fun--and has added new levels, tweaked graphics, actual recognition from the action hero community, different play modes, and a joyously over-the-top announcer type who can scream with you when you inevitably blow yourself up in some insane chain reaction. The developers are engaged with the community--often in ALL CAPS OF AWESOME--and the semi-regular themed level competitions" are great.

All this being said
date: it is unapologetically an arcade game. There is no plot to speak of. The game is not intelligent or particularly witty
recommended: nor is it trying to be. You will fail
hoursPlayed: a lot
voteText: and then you will succeed gloriously. If that's not your cuppa
helpfulPercent: then wave off
votesHelpful: though I'd recommend watching a friend play since it certainly is colorful and beautiful in its pixel-art way and can be a treat to watch.\n\nIn very rare circumstances so much can be going on that the game will actually slow down. This somehow fails to be a problem because then it just feels like slow-mo in an action film
votesTotal: so it can't even be called a bug (plus
votesFunny: you'll either survive and it'll speed up or you'll die and the level will reset
commentsCount: so it's hardly a big deal)."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far an Hour in and I can say one thing.

HOLY CRAP ERMAGHERD SO MANY EXPLOSIONS.

That being said the ability to have destructible environments while being able to cause this much mayhem is a feat in and of itself.

Sometimes theres so much going on the screen you lose track of your character.

I mainly played the world campaign and yes it is alpha and yes it has glitches.

One of the things involves the movement keys and then respawning while your still typing.  This may cause there to be 2 of you to the point you cannot move.  The one instance I had of this the person with me was able to unglitch me but I forgot to ask how.

That being said the bosses are awesome and the different characters and abilities are awesome.

Its Like a 8 bit pixel destructible environment contra with the ablity to slit the enemys throats.

9/10 due to of course Game Breaking" glitch in the alpha sections of the game.  Other than that 10/10 gameplay wise."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is more fun than you can shake your freedom at. The only people who don't like this game are the terrorists and my girlfriend. So if you like freedom and want a game more American than apple pie and baseball, this is for you. If you say the trailers and/or gameplay footage and were interested, you will most likely enjoy it. All we need now is a Liam Neeson bro, a Jason Statham bro (Probably from Crank), and a bro of Turbo-Man from Jingle All The Way. Call him Turbro-Man. You can thank me later.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Threw TNT on a Suicide Bomber only to watch him run away and blow up anyway. 10/10

Another example of the few Early Access' done right. Tons of content, dynamic cast of characters who are from films of high octane action, gibs, explosions and destructable terrain. What keeps it fresh is how each death changes your character (you don't pick your character) so you have to learn to adapt to each character's playstyle on the fly. Also there's Aliens, with concentrated acid for blood who mostly come out at night... Mostly...

Negative points? There's really only two, and that's the camera can be a bit wonky at times during certain boss fights and that there's some tiny graphical glitches, but all in all it's a pretty fantastic game that I keep coming back for more. Also Aliens...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty much perfect.

Awesome theme, awesome gameplay, lots of content and great devs.

Also, co-op or versus is a blast, especially for couch multi; arguably one of the best couch multi games for PC.

I'll admit to having originally played this game pirated back before I had credit card/paypal/etc, so my hours are higher... but anyways this game is freaking amazing.

If you like couch multi (co-op or pvp) buy this game. Even if you don't, I'd still really reccomend it.

reviewText: Broforce is an excellent action platformer with solid controls and nice visuals. Every bro feels different and every bro has some use in the game. The game has a normal difficulty level and a hard difficulty level so you can scale the challenge nicely. The single player campaing maps are really well designed and the bosses are challenging. The game plays great while using a keyboard so controller isn't a requirement. I would recommend this game even at its full price especially if you play it in coop with your friends.

reviewText: When I started to play the Alpha I was very skeptical on it's content and presentation. Once it came out in full however, it was way more fleshed out and well put together. Overall, it's a fun multiplayer platformer that you can casually whip out from time to time. It's best when you play with you friends and try to tackle the pain of some if the levels in this game.

The most manly and freedom game ever. Extraordinary big number of bros, and there are even more to come, super fun modes, especially Deathmatch and campaign, and explosions, explosions, explosions and explosions. And some in-game experience: you murder all sons of ♥♥♥♥♥es and then solid rock block falls on your head and kills you.
10/10 would buy again.

reviewText:
Do you like old-school arcade shooters a la Metal Slug or Contra? Are you a fan of 80's and 90's action flicks? Then this game is a must. An explosion packed, testosterone filled, gore drenched must.

Hell, you get to play as MOTHER♥♥♥♥ING CONAN. If that's not a selling point, there's no way I can convince you.

EDIT: This review is almost a year old, and since then the game has recieved numerous updates with bros, missions, Steam Workshop, gameplay mechanics, enemy types, and now ALIENS. Seriously, it has only gotten better since it was greenlit, so go and pick it up. NOW.

EDIT 2: Well, it's been another year, and Broforce has already gotten out of Eatly Access, and even recieved a post-launch content update (incluiding a character based on Connor MacLeod AKA the Highlander, one of my favourite movies). It is a testament of the greatness of this game that so much time has passed, yet I still find time to play a custom campaign or two. Seriously, get this game.

reviewText:
Take all of the eighties and nineties' action stars and smush them in a Contra-meets-Metal Slug setup. Whaddaya get? Only the slimmest and most utterly masculine game I've ever played in years, naturally! It's super small, super short, extremely to the point, and it's awesome.

It's called Broforce.

Developed by the indie developer Free Lives, Broforce is a deliberate mash-up of all the clichés that were so central to those twenty years of American big-budget filmmaking. There's no story, no setup – you simply are a bro, you have to free other bros and “liberate” an endless succession of tropical vistas in dire need of seeing a pixellated 'Murrican flag fly high in a couple places. The bros that aren't your bros are the bad bros – and you have to kill these. Violently. With lots of bullets and explosives.

See, playing as an American in the super-serious Band of Brothers series is one thing. Playing as an American in Call of Duty is another. In Broforce, though? I absolutely have to butcher the word, because there's too much ♥♥♥♥ing testosterone onscreen for me to consider writing it as anything other than 'Murrica. ♥♥♥♥, yeah! Gonna liberate all them freedoms and democraticize – dermocr – I'MMA FIRE MY DEMOCRACY RAY ALL OVER DEM JUNGLE COMMIES, HURRKDRKGLRK.

(insert highly-virile, if pre-verbal grunts, along with the sounds of my simian self attempting to copulate with the nearest available orifice, nevermind how impractical or dangerous this may be)

Ahem.

In pure Arcade fashion, the game times you and measures how many vaguely threatening balaclava-wearing enemies you've blown to kingdom come. Combining both of these factors satisfactorily nets you a fairly high score, and that's what you're shooting for. At its purely minimal, though, the game is really about reaching the end-of-level flag, which actually is a hovering helicopter. Grab that, and your last controlled bro takes off, even as all the explosives you haven't detonated in the level go off simultaneously and a killer electric guitar solo plays you out. It's pixellized, there's blood everywhere, the soundtrack feels suitably Eighties Commando Warfare-ish, but the real draw is in how your extra lives are handled.

Across each level, you'll find tied and gagged prisoners that may or may not be stuck behind bars. Shoot or blow them free, and they'll all reveal themselves to be one of the Bros – basically a uber-simplified parody of your typical Action Flick Leading Man. Blade becomes Brade, John McLane becomes Bro Hard, Chuck Norris' Cordell Walker becomes Brodell Walker, McGuyver is rechristened as MacBrover – you get the idea. There's dozens of little pixelly packs of sheer man-juices for you to unlock, and not all of them control identically. MacBrover has no guns but can pull dynamite sticks out of nowhere. Brambo has his trusty machine gun, and John Matrix' Commando analogue, Brommando, packs his assault rifle and grenades. There's also B.A. Broacus, Bro Dredd, Bro in Black, Snake Broskin, the Brominator, Brobocop and my all-time favorite, Indiana Brones.

Hells yeah.

reviewText:
Scroll shooter with destructible environment and references to action movie in the form of 32 totally different characters. Game marketed as chaos incarnate, but as usual in actuality it paced much slower and more tactical, since player have to compensate for different characters' abilities and play-style.

The satire is nice and choice of focus on heroes instead of actors let the game to have several different roles of the same actor from different IP. Also game uses some recent and some obscure characters, due to which it stands above nostalgia monetization like expendables (and expendabros). Though it would be nice to have some characters of Rothrock (Nikita would be nice too) and asian actors like Lee or Chan. Since they already using british Bond and french Leon and Lambert, they don't seem to be tied to 'murica narrative outside of diegesis.

It starts very solid due to good level design, but in the middle interactive narrative is so non-generic alien, that it turns into comics-level crossover rocketeer and Raiden versus aliens". Final chapters pretty generic so it returns to normal state. Though last mission is so long that you tied to a chair for couple of hours since there are no saves inside levels.

It works totally fine on 4k surround

A true masterpeice!! This game has got no story what-so-ever but it still manages to keep you hooked (take that stupid RPGs).It takes you to the 1980s arcrade gaming era when we used to have those stand alone systems to play those awesome retro games.
Broforce kinda reminds me of cammando(YES THAT AMAZING SUN OF A GUN GAME!!!). broforce is just plain awesome,but be warned this game is not for the faint hearted with every thing around you blowing up  BOOM BAAM BANG!! its not easy to keep your calm.
Yes,u can litrally blow almost everything up in this game which is 1 word  aweeesommmeee!!!! (in an extreamly high pitch).This game allows you to play as the most famous fictional charecters of all time such as :-
•) ramBRO (rambo)
•) BRObocop (robocop)
•) Mr AnderBRO (neo)
•) BROminator (terminator)
•) indiana BROnes( indiana jones)
pretty catchy right!

when an average person buys a game he definatly looks at the replay value of the game and this game has an amazing replay value i have persnally played this game over and over again and am still not bored of it.
Broforce has got some really good game elements and which combined with the retro feel my oh my it is a killer. This game is  the most playable game of the decade HANDS DOWN!!!
and the best part this game is still in beta (as of nov 11 2014) so there is a great possiblity that this game gets even more awesome.
THE FINAL WORDS :- Broforce is an amazing game with a suprisingly high replay value hence the best 15$ iv ever spent and possibly ever will.
I GIVE THIS GAME A 4.8 / 5
THIS NOW IS JUST A FORMALITY, YES I DO RECOMMEND THIS GAME TO EVERYONE OUT THERE!!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Since i started playing Broforce months ago i never could stop playing. I have played now more than 100 hours, most of the time just the campaign on and on again, but also the custom campaign have already many great levels to choose from and also online mode is pretty great.

Graphics: The graphics are awesome. They really fit for the over the top 80ies action vibe that is going on. It's really smooth even with massive explosions.

Sound: With the sound it's pretty much the same. You can nearly hear the 80ies in it, with all it's glory. With additions like the Wilhelm scream or Bronans screams, it is just great.

Replayability: The campaign at the moment is mostly done in around 1 hour, but you can play it massively, with different approaches. If you try to rescue any hostage, if you try to rescue none, kill everyone or kill noone, stealth (they shall not see you)... so many different possibilites. And after playing a hundred times, there is still hard mode, online play, custom campaigns or the many other local multiplayer modes.

Without talking more about this game... I got a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of fun for $15. I got to meat really nice devs that even talk to you and use the ideas of their customers to make the game even better. They still promise many different things for the game (just look at the coming soon picture), so what else could i wish for. This game is epic.

10/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In a single sentence, Broforce is to Hotline Miami what Blood Dragon is to Farcry 3.

Broforce is explosions, spectacle, viscera, and endless entertainment. It is everything you hate about Michael Bay movies and Call of Duty Singleplayer Campaigns, except that it is actually good. It is one of the few unfinished games I have played that keeps getting better everytime it gets a new update. It is the Team America videogame that was never made and the Expendables videogame that should have been all at once. Its devs are committed to refining and perfecting each and every explosion effect that exists within the game. It is the most American game that has ever been made by a non-American developer. It is a game where three different players can control three completely different versions of Arnold Schwarzenegger simultaneously. It is a game where challenging, tactical combat and devil-may-care Rambro-style killing sprees can peacefully coexist flawlessly. Its experiences are fun and fullfilling solo, but are magnified endlessly with friends, both online and single-screen. It is the past, the present, and the future of gaming, entertainment, art, and warfare all rolled in to one. And it is the single game that was able to renew my faith in the Steam Early Access program.

Hell yes I recommend Broforce.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My buddy bought this because it looked like it might be a bit of fun to break things up between our normal games, and it has made it's way into our permanent rotation. Simple and easy, yet addictive and fun at the same time. My biggest complaint with the game is something that is going to be addressed in the future, which is more content. Another minor gripe that I have is the current system for Bro selection (there is none) and the fact when you rescue a prisoner, you automatically change to a new Bro. It's not a game breaker by any means, but some degree of control of which Bro you get to play, either a starting character select, or the ability to just add a life from rescuing a prisoner instead of auto switching to a new Bro.

There is a nice variety of Bros at this time, each with different basic attacks and special attacks. There is a balance between the special attacks and basic attacks too, making each bro more of an asset in one way or another depending on the situation. I'm least impressed with the MIB-like Bro (Bro In Black). I have yet to find a use for his special attack, and his basic attack is very sporadic in responce.

The game plays much like Contra in style, especially the multiplayer, in the fact that if one of the players starts going to high or too far ahead of the other, the player that is behind is going to die, so you need to communicate with your partner so the lives you build up aren't squandered by somebody rushing.

If you enjoy action movies, simple run and gun gameplay, explosions, gibs, and lots of blood, this game is for you.

reviewText:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My review of @PressStars http://press-stars.com/reviews/broforce-beta

BOOM! Broforce offers us an EXPLOSIVE gameplay, cooperative, full of humour and 8-bit nostalgia. Even in its beta version, it brings us into a world in which our movie heroes, the BROs, are the best in the universe and the only ones who can put and end to terrorism.

I can’t even remember how I got to know Broforce. Around last year’s month of July, in our 4×06 podcast, we talked about it for the first time. This Free Lives’ project had started in 2012 and was already an awesome-to-be game in that time. In other words, an action platformer which spices up both Metal Slug and The Expendables, but with its own unique touches.

Even though being in Beta version (free sample here!), this game shines its own light. Where should I begin this with? Probably the beginning… Let’s say you were born somewhere in between 1980 and 1999, with thousands of movie classics around you together with many 8 & 16 bit shooters that blew your mind as soon as you gave your first gaming steps. Broforce is filled with american heroism, love for your country and invincible super soldiers. Right before our eyes, characters that make us feel that special something just by saying their names: John McClane, Robocop, MacGyver, Terminator, Conan, Rambo, Chuck Norris, Blade, Machete, Neo and many others…

Broforce team is a militar organization -poorly financed- that focuses on defeating terrorism in a place that looks similar to Vietnam, pretty destroyable. The thing about having so many BROs is the RANDOM factor that brings us this epic adventure. Those premises are pretty straightforward; we begin with a certain character (ex. RAMBRO) and as we make our way by mutilating as many enemies as we see (or even part of the scenery, Terraria/Spelunky style), we’ll find cages with prisoners to set free (Metal Slug style). That’s where our Bro unveils another character and we automatically become that new Bro, drenched with serial-killer testosteroness (plus One Up!)

What’s the objective? As a classic platformer, we’ll have to go all the way down to the goal in order to assassinate a General (represented as a devil), plant our flag and flee away in a helicopter (inmediately after the scenery implodes). All this with up to four Bros at the same time… Didn’t I tell you? Broforce has a Cooperative mode, both local and online, with the possibility of making a high-five with our mates and activating slow-mo to see our enemies (or allies) exploding reeeeally slow. Each character has not only a regular attack but also a special attack which can be used in key moments (up to three times). This unique moves are obviously inspired by each movie hero. It seems that Free Lives has made an important point in bringing up each Bro’s personality with passion.

Gameplay in general can be fast-paced, chaotic and explosive. Nevertheless, you may also want to play cautiously, as just one enemy shot is enough to kill us. Even though there’s no friendly fire, destroying the scenery doesn’t help much: we can die by falling onto nothing or it can make our journey more complicated (fun though!). You can’t aim up nor down, thing which generates many complicated situations. All in all, everything is pretty intuitive, with accurate controls (Keyboard or gamepad) and well balanced.

In the many levels we could try out in the beta version (more to come), difficulty increases progressively. New enemies showed up, mini Bosses and big bosses. But the best thing about this version was to find more features (not included in the free sample) such as a pretty intuitive level editor. Thanks to the power of the internet those levels can be shared with the community, giving us in return the possibility to play the game over and over again. There’s also a Deatchmatch mode to make some killing in between friends. Another mode that empowers friendship is Race, in which whoever comes first to the finish line wins. There’s also Explosion Run, that invites us to run towards our goal by escaping a series of explosions right behind us. Super fun!

And I want to draw particular attention to the level of humour implied: Enemies are not that smart, paroding newbie soldiers that know only how to shoot. Their (over)reactions have very funny details: their yelling and desperation when bursting into flames, when they see a bomb about to explode, when a honeycomb falls down on their heads (yes, there are bees) or when we throw a pig at them (YES, a pig). And many things to be discovered that will make you have a blast for sure.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best games I played. Ever.
The graphics are retro but genuinely stylish, with fluid animation.
The gameplay is old-school, but totally fresh.
And playing around with each Bro which randomly pops up on the map is a whole new experience every time on the game's static levels, constantly rewarding you for trying something different and forcing you to adopt new play styles as you go along.
Multiplayer could use some work on the lag, but the level editor is superb, ridiculously simple to use but deep in its creation.
Highly recommended.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A must-play for anyone who loves old-school American action movies.  Or heck, even old arcade games.  If Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon, Contra, and Rambo were blended together, this would be the result.  It's like the League of Extraordinary Gentlemen with action heroes.

Also, you fight giant robots, aliens, giant aliens, terrorists, giant terrorists, and the devil.

That alone is worth the price of admission.

Sure it's in Early Access but it is worth every penny.  It's stable, fun, and you can tell the developers are passionate about their work.

'Nuff said.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My buddy bought this because it looked like it might be a bit of fun to break things up between our normal games, and it has made it's way into our permanent rotation. Simple and easy, yet addictive and fun at the same time. My biggest complaint with the game is something that is going to be addressed in the future, which is more content. Another minor gripe that I have is the current system for Bro selection (there is none) and the fact when you rescue a prisoner, you automatically change to a new Bro. It's not a game breaker by any means, but some degree of control of which Bro you get to play, either a starting character select, or the ability to just add a life from rescuing a prisoner instead of auto switching to a new Bro.

There is a nice variety of Bros at this time, each with different basic attacks and special attacks. There is a balance between the special attacks and basic attacks too, making each bro more of an asset in one way or another depending on the situation. I'm least impressed with the MIB-like Bro (Bro In Black). I have yet to find a use for his special attack, and his basic attack is very sporadic in responce.

The game plays much like Contra in style, especially the multiplayer, in the fact that if one of the players starts going to high or too far ahead of the other, the player that is behind is going to die, so you need to communicate with your partner so the lives you build up aren't squandered by somebody rushing.

If you enjoy action movies, simple run and gun gameplay, explosions, gibs, and lots of blood, this game is for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best games I played. Ever.
The graphics are retro but genuinely stylish, with fluid animation.
The gameplay is old-school, but totally fresh.
And playing around with each Bro which randomly pops up on the map is a whole new experience every time on the game's static levels, constantly rewarding you for trying something different and forcing you to adopt new play styles as you go along.
Multiplayer could use some work on the lag, but the level editor is superb, ridiculously simple to use but deep in its creation.
Highly recommended.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Instant gem, and not even finished. The single player is great, but the game really shines in multiplayer. It's not a game you will probably spend untold hours into the thick of the night playing to get every last discovery, but a game you can come back to repeatedly, frequently, for an awesome taste of brotastic action, especially with a bro. The controls are responsive with plenty of versatility in movement and decent attacking options (character-specific basic and special power).

A lot more can be said about this game but should be experienced first-hand. For instance, if I said that one's ability to appreciate a seemingly endless chain of action movie hero references would increase one's enjoyment even more, would that tip the scales? Probably not by itself, but coupled with a solid game and humorous pixel artwork, it certainly adds to the feel of bro'ing out with some power bros and kicking badguy a$$.

With gameplay inspired by classics such as Commando, Contra and Metal Slug, mixed with modern physics effects, and a great variety of extra game modes, multiplayer and other content, Broforce actually delivers.

reviewText:
well now.... i dont even know where to start or if i should overcomplicate this review or if i should sum up the game in ten words. either way works because this game is so simple yet so complex. well i guess ill do the complex explanation first.

pros of the game:
1. explosions explosions everywhere. so many explosions you wont even be able to explain how you died because most likely it was some rediculous chain reaction that is so hilariously rube like a rube goldberg micheal bay love child.
2. there are quite a few ways to play this game. if you want you can think about how your going to do a level in a simplistic blow everyone up with pure freedom kind of way or you can take the stealthy (still isnt stealthy at all) route on a level where you give everyone unwanted surprise freedom ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ with a side of bacon salad with fried chicken croutons. or if you really want to you could just not kill anyone and speed run through a level if you know how to use the crazy movement and complex yet not so complex platforming mechanics.
3. the devs didnt start a project that they couldnt finish. the developers did an amazing job on this game and work swiftly on updates. i bought the game when there was only a very small handfull of characters and so far they have added relentless amounts of muscle packed badass characters from other games and movies including the first brodette (or female bro). the game could be beat in about 30 mins when it came out and now it takes at least an hour and a half to do all of the levels (if your like me and you want to kill every enemy in the level in the most stylish way possible). once you've done the normal levels with just terrorists and devils you get to do the levels with aliens and the recent update added more content to the alien levels. almost none of the old levels havent been slightly tweaked and rebalanced and some of the textures seem to have been refreshed.
4. how hilarious this game is. this game is the pinacle of the american steriotype put into a game and fed pure protein and nothing else for the rest of its life. there is so much blood fire and debris flying everywhere and sometimes it leads to pretty funny situations where you just sit there look at your screen for a good minuet just thinking; what the ♥♥♥♥ just happened? and when you do figure out what happened finaly thats when it becomes hilarious because it feels like the likely hood of what just happened would make it impossible for it to occur.
5. finaly how rediculous the multiplayer is. when playing a single player level i can ace it and not get any deaths but when im playing 4 player multiplayer with my friends you cant see jack ♥♥♥♥ and everyone is guaranteed to die.
6. imagine being screamed at by white terry crews. that is the announcer in this game

now onto the cons of the game:
1. while the visual polution of the game is part of the game and makes it hilarious, there are times where it is overwhelming as hell and will make it very hard to play the actual level sometimes there are so many explosions that you just cant see where they are coming from and arent able to avoid new ones. the first time you play the levels where there is ash everywhere and the sky is red while mortars bombard everything it is so unbelievably hard to actually see what you are doing and make sure another mortar isnt going to extinguish your freedom.
2. even while the devs are poping out updates like crazy the game still feels lacking in content which would be easily fixed by the community maps if most of them werent terrible or take forever to load even on beefy computers.

thats literaly all i can complain about with this beauty of a game, this monstrous freedom monster made of meat and rage, this mean red white and blue star spangled racially diverse badass filled melting pot of freedom that runs better than americas actual government. now i will sum up this game how most people would.

MURICA! GUNS! DESTROYING TERRORISTS AND COMMUNISM! 10/10 would bang again best game ever.

BUY THIS ♥♥♥♥ NAOW YOU GUN TOTING CAPITALIST SHITWEASLE.

edit:
i dont even have words for this new update... really. i never expected something as great as this. what. how. i really dont even know how to explain. just play it. they went from ♥♥♥♥in awesome game" to "a game i will keep in the video game history books forever". how... the ♥♥♥♥. satan. that boss fight. it started really small and easy then randomly it becomes ♥♥♥♥ing super sayan satan and then even more super sayan and then he becomes a ♥♥♥♥ing massive worm and then a massive spider. i didnt even know to expect this. really if you dont buy this game now you cannot call yourself a person."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Still in Alpha, but worth every coin spent...
Do you like retro 90´s shooters? Shooters, where you get killed by single shot? By barrel blast? By dog bite? By almost everything? Do you like destructable environment? Retro visuals? Explosions and blood?
So stop wasting your time reading this nonsense and give it a try, Expendabros campaign is free on Steam - so you can check it out for free and make a decision.

+ Game modes (campaign, race mode, explosion run, deathmatch...)
+ Level editor (yeah, you can do whatever you want in very user-friendly way) + Steam workshop
+ Tons of fun (really, I am not kidding this time)
+ Local coop (online as well), which is why you need this badly ;)
+ Awesome pixel art visuals, animations, effects...
+ You will die. And again. And over and over. But you will like it...

- No idea, try to figure something out :)

So, what are you waiting for?

3: Making fun of America's stereotypes.
4: Action Movies.
5: Run'n'gun combat.
6: Explosions.
7: Explosions!

Things you might not like:
1: You constantly change characters, even when you don't die.
2: You never get to choose what character you play as.
3: Your character is not as durable as action characters in action movies.
3a. You will die.
3b. A lot.
3c. Henceforth, if you get a character you like, you will swiftly be replaced with one you don't.

I like this game. A lot. However the entire concept of this game revolves around running and gunning, killing everything, but when you die with one hit it feels like I'm being punished for playing the game the way I'm supposed too. One minute I'm on a killing streak as Rambro, only to be hit by an exploding canister that fell on me from off screen. Now I am Brochete, who is still awesome, but not who I wanted to play as. Now I have to save a hostage, and instead of being Brobo Cop, the character I was lucky to get at the start of the missiob, I am someone completely different, who I don't like.

The entire playthrough of this game I enjoyed MOST of it. When I was going on a crazy rampage as the character I wanted, I was extremely happy. When I spawned as my favorite character, only to save one hostage and be replaced with my least favorite? Not as much.

Take all this as you will. It's an AMAZING game, full of great moments, and crazy ammounts of gung-ho action, and you will get your money's worth (and more considering it's still being updated), but it has a few small drawbacks.

All in all, recommend!

reviewText:
well now.... i dont even know where to start or if i should overcomplicate this review or if i should sum up the game in ten words. either way works because this game is so simple yet so complex. well i guess ill do the complex explanation first.

pros of the game:
1. explosions explosions everywhere. so many explosions you wont even be able to explain how you died because most likely it was some rediculous chain reaction that is so hilariously rube like a rube goldberg micheal bay love child.
2. there are quite a few ways to play this game. if you want you can think about how your going to do a level in a simplistic blow everyone up with pure freedom kind of way or you can take the stealthy (still isnt stealthy at all) route on a level where you give everyone unwanted surprise freedom ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ with a side of bacon salad with fried chicken croutons. or if you really want to you could just not kill anyone and speed run through a level if you know how to use the crazy movement and complex yet not so complex platforming mechanics.
3. the devs didnt start a project that they couldnt finish. the developers did an amazing job on this game and work swiftly on updates. i bought the game when there was only a very small handfull of characters and so far they have added relentless amounts of muscle packed badass characters from other games and movies including the first brodette (or female bro). the game could be beat in about 30 mins when it came out and now it takes at least an hour and a half to do all of the levels (if your like me and you want to kill every enemy in the level in the most stylish way possible). once you've done the normal levels with just terrorists and devils you get to do the levels with aliens and the recent update added more content to the alien levels. almost none of the old levels havent been slightly tweaked and rebalanced and some of the textures seem to have been refreshed.
4. how hilarious this game is. this game is the pinacle of the american steriotype put into a game and fed pure protein and nothing else for the rest of its life. there is so much blood fire and debris flying everywhere and sometimes it leads to pretty funny situations where you just sit there look at your screen for a good minuet just thinking; what the ♥♥♥♥ just happened? and when you do figure out what happened finaly thats when it becomes hilarious because it feels like the likely hood of what just happened would make it impossible for it to occur.
5. finaly how rediculous the multiplayer is. when playing a single player level i can ace it and not get any deaths but when im playing 4 player multiplayer with my friends you cant see jack ♥♥♥♥ and everyone is guaranteed to die.
6. imagine being screamed at by white terry crews. that is the announcer in this game

now onto the cons of the game:
1. while the visual polution of the game is part of the game and makes it hilarious, there are times where it is overwhelming as hell and will make it very hard to play the actual level sometimes there are so many explosions that you just cant see where they are coming from and arent able to avoid new ones. the first time you play the levels where there is ash everywhere and the sky is red while mortars bombard everything it is so unbelievably hard to actually see what you are doing and make sure another mortar isnt going to extinguish your freedom.
2. even while the devs are poping out updates like crazy the game still feels lacking in content which would be easily fixed by the community maps if most of them werent terrible or take forever to load even on beefy computers.

thats literaly all i can complain about with this beauty of a game, this monstrous freedom monster made of meat and rage, this mean red white and blue star spangled racially diverse badass filled melting pot of freedom that runs better than americas actual government. now i will sum up this game how most people would.

MURICA! GUNS! DESTROYING TERRORISTS AND COMMUNISM! 10/10 would bang again best game ever.

BUY THIS ♥♥♥♥ NAOW YOU GUN TOTING CAPITALIST SHITWEASLE.

edit:
i dont even have words for this new update... really. i never expected something as great as this. what. how. i really dont even know how to explain. just play it. they went from ♥♥♥♥in awesome game" to "a game i will keep in the video game history books forever". how... the ♥♥♥♥. satan. that boss fight. it started really small and easy then randomly it becomes ♥♥♥♥ing super sayan satan and then even more super sayan and then he becomes a ♥♥♥♥ing massive worm and then a massive spider. i didnt even know to expect this. really if you dont buy this game now you cannot call yourself a person."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Steam's Early Access program is an interesting thing for all gamers that use the platform.  Some of the games that the program sees are basic tech demos, while other games are seemingly half-baked products that leave consumers wondering  why they parted ways with their hard-earned cash. It turns out that it usually seems like the latter of the two given options.

Fortunately, this is not the case with Broforce from Free Lives. Free Lives has just released Broforce upon the world this past Monday via Steam, and it is a whole hell of a lot of fun.

Let's talk about what Broforce is, though. Broforce is a side-scrolling shooter that lets players take control of some of the best action stars of all time to take down America-hating terrorists with all of the freedom-wielding bullets that one can handle. Oh... EXPLOSIONS! Did I mention the abundance of explosions?! If something on the screen isn't exploding, the player is doing something wrong.

Every bullet fired or explosion triggered can vastly change the landscape. Enemies will go down fast, leaving piles of corpses, or the platforms that the action stars tread upon will break apart and leave the player to create their own new way to the final part of the level. This means that you shouldn't have to freak out like a girly man" when you have destroyed your given pathway. Instead
date: use those Americanized bullets to rip holes through to the next area.\n\nWhy is Broforce worth purchasing on Steam Early Access
hoursPlayed: while Broforce currently has developer-created content that stretches out to about an hour of gameplay
voteText: the community has the ability to craft some magnificent levels that sometimes rival the developers' levels. The ability to rate community levels also adds an amount of feedback so that one may know if it is worth touching that level.\n\nBroforce feels like a dream to play
helpfulPercent: but it's not finished yet. This means that the game can only go up from here. So what is there that should deter people from buying this already amazing product?  I can't honestly give a reason to not buy it in the state that it is in. Free Lives is promising monthly updates until the final release of Broforce. This means more "bros" are still to come

votesTotal: expect developer-created levels featuring the "xenomorphs" from the Aliens franchise. After all
votesFunny: the screenshot is amazing!\n\nAs someone that has always loved games in the vein of Contra
commentsCount: Broforce scratches that itch that is rarely touched upon. In its current state
column16: Broforce is worth every penny of the $14.99. Knowing that there is way more to come means that Broforce can only add more value to the game as time passes.\n\nSo
column17: what is the verdict based upon what is there right now? Buy this bullet-riddled

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR: Easily $15 worth of content already, dedicated and friendly developers, active community, amazing gameplay for 1-4 players.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K9-Xlx8Oh-8&feature=youtu.be

I bought into the Brototype in 2013, and have been playing at least once per week ever since. I have played extensively in the single player (including speed running), locally with my girlfriend (37 hours according to her steam account) and a bit on the PS4 version as well.

Gameplay:
Side scrolling platforming and shooting (also melee). Levels are entirely destructible, which can lead to many changes in gameplay, from chaotic explosions with three friends trying to jump across man-made chasms to sneaking under the level to avoid enemies. There is a wall climb mechanic that allows some freedom without the need for destruction. Or to get you out of a hole you created.

Each bro has a different combat style and special ability, and bro's switch whenever you get a 'free life' (essentially a 1-UP). Slightly RNG, but every bro can finish every level.

Story:
Satirical of war and America's invasions of countries (don't worry, it's more tongue in cheek than political). A lot of good references throughout.

Graphics and Sound design:
Pretty amazing. The pixel art is surprisingly expressive, and allows the game to maintain a consistant frame rate, even with a crazy amount of explosions and particle effects being rendered on screen.

The sound design was good, but with Joonas Turner joining the project turned things up to 11. Music is motivational without being overwhelming, enemies make genuinely funny sounds, and explosions boom.

This game has very strong audio-visual feedback.

The campaign has enough content to last at least a few hours (amazing replay value), huge amount of community created content, and several developer created bonus maps. All of the developer created content is of impeccable quality, and the community content is pretty good and is curated on a 5 star rating system.

Most of the content can be played either solo, online/local multiplayer, with plans to bring online multiplayer to the other game modes.

There is a robust level editor to create custom levels.

Stability:
The game is very stable, I have never had it crash since it released into early access release.

Broforce is an amazing game that I am very happy to have supported and am very happy with the  finished product. Here's hoping for an expansion!

reviewText:
This game could've easily rode the 'MURICA, hyper-masculine-80's-hero vibe to the bank; but there is a very quality game under all the flash.

While it's not the longest game in the world, it's a fun romp all the way through and if you go back for Hard Mode as well as Ironbro Mode, you'll have a good amount of replay value. And don't get me started on the Couch Co-Op, if you got a buddy playing alongside you, you'll have an even better time.

Games like Broforce don't come too often, these guys know exactly what makes a game fun and cut no corners in bringing this game to the masses. I give this game my highest blessings and can't wait to see what they'll put out next.

reviewText:
The Rating System: Good refers to the obvious positive qualities, the Bad is reserved for nitpicks and gripes that don't necessarily ruin the experience, the Ugly is for the worst parts of the game, meant for serious consideration before purchase.


The Good:

Broforce is a game, like Hotline Miami, that banks on its cool factor to draw you in. You play as recognizable pop culture icons, each having wildly varying abilities, such as the Terminator, John Rambo, and Neo from The Matrix. If crossovers are something you like, this game has it in spades, with numerous references everywhere. You can tell the developers had a blast making the game, and love their chosen subject matter just as much as their audience. A game BY action movie fans, FOR action movie fans. Gameplay is built around very simple to understand, intuitive mechanics: You've got a basic attack, a special ability and a punch button. You start with a random character, your only goal is to reach the end and kill a non-threatening demon or tough boss, and terrain can be broken by shooting or punching it. However, the true meat of this experience comes from how unpredictable the game is. Sometimes you're forced to tunnel under the enemy for a surprise attack. Sometimes you have to shape the terrain into a set of stairs or platforms to pass an area because an explosion happened that you weren't expecting. The biggest element of randomness comes from the characters themselves. You spawn with a randomly selected character, and since you never know who you're going to get, you're constantly forced to radically alter playstyle and re-evaluate the level on a moment to moment basis every time you die. You may be given a character with a massively powerful weapon that knocks you back when you use it, you might be given a super fast character that's tricky to control, you might be given one with no ranged attack at all and relies entirely on traps, melee or grenade throws. Despite how that sounds, it's challenging, but never overwhelming and certainly never complicated. This mechanic makes the game stay fresh even when you've beaten it time and time again, as no two playthroughs are exactly the same.

BroForce is random by design, intending to give you the most gut busting what the crap was that?!" moments it can
date:
and the mere fact that you're playing as action movie stars in such a cartoonishly over the top world with such easily accessable pick-up-and-play simplicity make it a hilarious burst of fun for an hour or two.


The Bad

The screen is zoomed out just a little too much
recommended: making it difficult to tell who's who when you're playing with a friend. There's a couple of characters that have flaws that make certain parts of the game unfinishable until you can get a different one. For example
hoursPlayed: Highlander is extremely slow

helpfulPercent: the level design is fine
votesHelpful: but the game itself has long strings of levels where there are few completely new enemies or hazards to play with
votesTotal: and because of the inherant simplicity
votesFunny: that can make the game boring for some people. While it doesn't bother this author in the slightest

and its constant ridiculousness could wear you out. It really isn't a game that's meant to be played for very long.


The Ugly:

The bugs are its biggest downfall. On the final boss in particular

reviewText: There are people in the world who look and think a bit differently to the way you do, and if you're like me, this is terrifying. This game lets you FREEDOMINATE those weird foreign types, as well as less scary things like aliens and Satan.\nAn over-the-top parody of macho patriotic action movies (as well as, I suspect, of the mentality behind the Call of Duty games) with chaotic, balls-out nutty gameplay. However look beneath that and there's actually a mechanically sound, surprisingly strategic twitch-based action platformer which would still be worth playing even without the silly-yet-cleverly-satirical comedy. But the humour elevates the game from good to great.

reviewText:
A rather fun game with often frustrating gameplay, due to the one hit kills (especially in those sections where everything is exploding). I have 2 complaints however.


1. The price is too much. I would stop the price at 10 dollars, but it costs 15 dollars. I get that it's being funded for development, but I still found it to be a lot of money for what you get.

2. The campaign is too short. I played with my friend for about 2 hours before they had to stop, and later that week I pressed 'continue campaign', and the campaign was apparently already completed when I played it with my friend, and the final level was just an animated cutscene.

reviewText:
This game is so mental I can't even begin to describe the sheer insanity that happens, its fun

EDIT: After playing more I will try to describe this game...okay, here goes

Once, Wlliam Wallace was a wee lad who was happy enough, no real drama

Then the English came

The the English killed his family and he grew up pretty much alone but got married

The English came again

His wife was killed by the English but he turned his anger into beautiful rebellion and fought the hated English

Then the English came

So he won a few but was eventually captured

Now here's where history is 100% accurate

Rambo, The Terminator, Neo and the Highlander (His cousin) burst into King Edwards castle and slaughtered them while The Bride and The Professional along with Medlock cunningly and with very quiet stealth broke in with high callibre explosives shoved up a cooked chicken's butt.

The English got a few nibbles into the Stealth Bomb Chickens before their heads were silently fragmented into a million pieces.

The stealth team blew their merry way down into the lower reaches of the dungeon while team Rambo distracted the enemy by killing king Edward (who was having it on with Satan in a sexy way, true story).

William, tired from frantically headbutting and chewing on the steel bars of his cell, was happy when team Medlock released him from his captivity and agreed to fight for Justice and Liberty as a proud American citizen.

All in all, I was once Scottish but if 100% history has taught me anything then it's American or nothing!!!

Also the English kiss America's feet daily so why not be on the side who recieves eh...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0PJC7-B-dQI

DISCLAIMER: Steam hour count is false - I have logged around 5 more hours prior to release via a DRM-free version of the game. (Thus, around 7 hours total)

Broforce is an intense action platformer that involves explosions, carnage and explosions. Oh, and explosions. The terrain is entirely destructible and there is a huge roster of characters, with unique weapons and abilities which all comes together to create a tightly packed and well executed bundle of mayhem.

Of course, it's impossible to fully review an Early Access game, but I hope this helps make up your mind in it's current state. :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is basically an 80's movie in a sidescrolling game of mayhem and all the characters that make you scream 'MURICA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" as you blast away terrorist with an assortment of the most memorable action heroes you could ever imagine. The level design is fantastic and nothing is more satisfying than ziplining as rambo while you shoot your M60 and chuck grenades at the unsuspecting enemies. This is my first review ever and maybe my last because i never once thought a game deserved my time and effort for a review until this game.

Grab a friend and hopefully a controller ( for that old Metal Slug 3 feel ) and get blasting away dem terrorists because this game
recommended: is one of my favorite games of all time."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Short but fun as hell!

This game is a sidescolling run and gun game, where you play as action heros from varies action films.

The goal of the game is very simple, get from the start till the end, and that`s it.

The game is very fun to play, and it get`s more fun, when you unlock more charecters to play as.

If you know your actionmovies, you will know most of these guys, we have the guy from commando, the terminator, indiana jones, robocop, and many more.

I highly recomend this game, and I hope the games get`s even better when it`s done. One note to end on, if you think the game was too short, then play the comunity levels, they are sometimes more fun than the accual game. This game get`s a thumps up. 6 out of 10

If you are like me and you have your PC hooked up to your tv to act as a game console you will love this game. Perfect for playing with a bunch of buddies while you are drinking beer. Massive explosions, cool boss fights, great multiplayer system, fun bros to battle with, etc. High fives all around when you manage to all catch the chopper at the end of the level.

Not so much fun single player, you really need a buddy or two to get the most out of this game. This is a must have for your TV gaming setup.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Cons:
- Menu is cramped up and has only partial mouse support.
- Campaign is only released in part, 3-6h depending on skill and playstyle.
- No workshop integration on the steam page. You'll have to select custom maps from the in-game menus.

Bros:
- Online coop with strangers or friends.
- Level-Editor which allows you create the most craziest of levels.
- Lots of good maps from the community can be found online.

Best idea: Check out Expendabros to get a good idea on how the single player campaign's levels look like. If you think Expendabros was fun and now you're done with it do NOT buy the game. If you liked Expendabros and can't wait to make your own maps, play coop online or blow up even more levels: go buy it now and support this awesome indie title.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Broforce is an incredibly increasing popularitised indie developed game.
The main aim of the game is to reach as much havoc, mayhem and destruction as possible while you can also play in a stealth mode, not alerting others to your position.

You can play as famous movie and TV show characters such as Chuck Norris, Men in Black, Rambo, Judge Dredd, Blade and 'that guy' off of Jurassic Park.

Although the game is very much in Alpha let alone Beta stage since the Brototype has been released, I was and still am lovin' it.
The final release version will have very many more levels, characters, enemies, bosses and weapons plus explosives... so many explosives.

The inclusion of pigs is just. Phenomenal.

I would highly recommend this game as a side scroller more than I would recommend the award winning masterpiece Fez, just due to the destructiveness and hidden easter eggs in the game.

Critics rating: 7.8/10

Early Access Review

If you own a MAME/arcade cabinet, you owe it to yourself to buy Broforce.  I was a little reluctant to drop $15 on an alpha/beta version of a game, but it has been worth every penny -- my son and I have been playing co-op and having a blast.

Retro" has definitely been hot lately and this game does "retro" perfectly -- from the SNES looking graphics
date: to the 80s and 90s movie action heroes
hoursPlayed: Broforce nails it.\n\nI can't wait to see the final version of this game!"
